page.title: 10CHURCHES IN HEDON
page.content: There are three churches in{Hedon} St.Mary and St.Joseph,the Roman Catholic church.The Methodist church and St.Augustines which is Church of England.St.Augustines is known as the "King of Holderness" and was started in 1190 and is a Grade 1 listed building.After a delay due to the Black Death in 1368 the tower was built in 1427 and the church completed in 1500 A.D. Since then it has been constantly repaired and renovated with the addition of new windows in the 19th and early 20th centuries.The Methodist and Roman Catholic churches are much younger. The Methodist church was built in 1926 and the Roman Catholic church in 1805. The original Methodist church was destroyed by bombing in W.W.1 whilst the Roman Catholic church also suffered damage to all but one of its windows.
